revised_title: High-Temperature Debye-Scherrer Camera and Lattice Spacing of Silver
tldr: The authors developed a high-temperature Debye-Scherrer camera capable of accurately measuring lattice spacings at temperatures up to 1000°C. They applied this camera to study the lattice spacing of silver at temperatures up to 94°C and found an equation that gives the coefficient of expansion of silver from the absolute zero to the melting point.
